choices.D: Remove because she only represents the Information Technology Division.
choices.B: Add 'Director of Facilities' because he is responsible for the design of the future organization, processes, systems and operation models for Facilities.
choices.E: Replace with 'Director of Facilities' because he supports the initiative and has many ideas about how to improve the service.
choices.C: Add 'Hardware Manager' because he provides computer hardware to all business functions and will be impacted by the outcome.
choices.A: Retain because she is responsible for the design of the future Information Technology organization and working practices.

questions.question_text: Which 2 alternative actions apply to the proposed Senior Supplier for this project?
Which 2 alternative actions apply to the proposed business assurance for this project?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: DE
D and E

choices.A: Remove because he will be impacted by the project and therefore represents a user.
choices.E: Retain because he is familiar with the Ministry of Food Hygiene business strategy, the business level risk assessment and the Business Case standards.
choices.C: Add Outcome Consultants' because they carried out the feasibility study.
choices.D: Add 'Director of Finance Division' because she is responsible for checking that any supplier and contractor payments are authorized.
choices.B: Replace with 'Project Manager' because this is a simple project that does not require additional business assurance.

choices.E: Remove because he is involved with the project and is therefore NOT independent.
choices.D: Add 'Outcome Account Manager' because he will advise on potential changes and their impact on the integrity of the project's products.
choices.A: Retain because he has a professional facilities qualification and so is in a position to specify the needs of his division.
choices.B: Retain because he will be able to advise on many of the products that will enable outsourcing to happen, such as the 10-year outsourcing service contract.
choices.C: Retain because he is well-regarded within the Ministry because of the efficiencies, superb service and savings he has achieved in the Facilities Division.

questions.question_text: Which 2 alternative actions apply to the proposed supplier assurance for this project?

discussion.content:
B. Delete entry 3 because this is NOT a major product to be delivered by this project. Full colour is not a product, but a quality criterion or a format specification for the calendar displays.
C. Move entry 6 to Derivation because this product already exists. The list of customers is not a product that will be created by the project, but a source product that already exists and will be used to derive the label design and the distribution plan.

questions.question_text: Which 2 statements apply to the Composition section?

choices.B: Delete entry 3 because this is NOT a major product to be delivered by this project.
choices.D: Delete entry 7 because these will be produced by the photographer.
choices.C: Move entry 6 to Derivation because this product already exists.

choices.D: Move entry 12 to Composition, because this is within the scope of this project.
choices.C: Delete entry 11 as this is already correctly shown under Development Skills required.
choices.A: Move entry 9 to Composition because this is within the scope of the project.
choices.B: Delete entry 10 because this is NOT a source product for this project.

questions.question_text: Which 2 statements apply to the Derivation section?

discussion.content:
B. Delete entry 10 because this is NOT a source product for this project. Previous calendar designs are not relevant to the current project product and do not affect its design.
C. Delete entry 11 as this is already correctly shown under Development Skills required. Internal creative team is not a source product, but a skill type that is needed to produce the project product.
